quote_text: A classification is a relationship not a fact
Stability is change slow enough to work with
Capital thinks in categories we think in gradients
Stable compared to what and when and for how long
Verification decays over time
Date and time your verifications
Conditions matter more than observation
Never verify what you havent handled yourself
Trust the feeling it is data
Feelings are unreliable only conditions matter
Protocols were written for Capital conditions
Translation is not deviation
Adapt consistently same situation same adaptation
Never explain to someone who wont understand
Safest adaptation is one no one notices
Bureau is a system not malicious
Vance believes hes helping he is wrong
Bureau studies individuals we study conditions
When Bureau measures it changes what is measured
Your job is to survive everything else is secondary
Crusaders get terminated
Pass exam their way work the way you need
Build reputation for reliability not insight
Some of you will make it to Capital and pretend
Archive work is navigation through uncertainty
You maintain relationships not records
Classification system assumes stable world
Ask what conditions made procedure succeed elsewhere
Im not supposed to teach you this but someone has to
What I tell you my predecessor told me
Knowledge lives in people not documents
Someday this might change until then we teach each other
Dont write this down
The Dens are laughing at our categories
Document that changes isnt unstable dead one is
Bureau wants us to fail quietly
Original curriculum worked before standardization
Regional conditions were acknowledged before
Standardization was political not pedagogical
Build context before applying procedure
Assess stability before processing
Test procedure against reality systematically
Fix process when it consistently fails
Dont trust anyone who pushes too fast
Watch for those who document everything
